head.supplied: QUARTERLY ESTIMATE. ¶ To the Honorable ¶ ¶ the Chief Secretary ¶ Sir ¶ , ¶ I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the Quarter ending ¶ ¶ 30th June ¶ ¶...

div.p: S80/3797, unit 1142, VPRS 3991/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.

note.p: MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M.

div.p: To the Honorable the Chief Secretary
I have the honor to submit for approval the following Estimate* of Expenditure during the Quarter ending 30th June 1880.

cell.p:
130 struck through, 80 inserted in another hand that made all alterations recorded below . M to G. Berry, 24 January 1880 asked for the transfers recorded below in notes to the 'Remarks' column.
130

two lines

cell.p:
Paper for Lithograms
Paper … Lithograms struck through.

border-top: none; border-left: 0.0069in solid #000000; border-bottom: none; border-right: 0.0208in solid #000000; padding-top: 0in; padding-left: 0.0555in; padding-bottom: 0in; padding-right: 0.0555in;
cell.p:
Towards Flora Australiensis
In the two previous estimates no provision for expenditure in the relevant quarter had been made;seeM to G. Berry, 7 September 1878 and notes thereto, andM to G. Berry, 28 January 1880. Although no approval of requests to use this budget line for support of a collector in preparation of an updated supplement has been found,the first estimate for the next financial year, M to R. Ramsay, 29 July 1880,includes £125 for the line 'Towards Flora Australiensis' inthe'Particulars of Vote'. When Parliament approved the votes for 1880-81 on 21 December 1880, the sum was retained, desscribed as 'Collector of Plants for a new edition of the Flora Australiensis' (Victoria, Votes and Proceedings of the Legislative Assembly, session 1880 - 81, vol. 1, p. 162).

cell.p:
Total — Fourhundred andsixtysix pounds one shilling
s deleted.
and eight pence
